title: Divorce-Paid off my $80,000 student loan using house refinance money 6yr ago. DH attorney says I owe $80,000 cuz student loan
question: House appraised at 485, 000. Owe 485, 000.
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Community property in divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law
answers: Generally speaking student loans are separate property debts. As a result if community property funds are used to pay those debts then educated spouse must repay the community unless they can show that the community received a substantial benefit as a result of the education. To determine this you need to speak to an experienced family law attorney who can gather more information from you and advise you accordingly.

Yes, your student loan is paid off, based on what you said. However, you may be required to reimburse the community for some or all of the loan paid off. [Note that you are half of the community, if you have to reimburse the community, only half of the total reimbursement goes to your former spouse.]

When evaluating whether or not you have to reimburse the community, there are a number of factors to consider. Of great significance is whether or not the community benefited from your education. For instance, if you have been working for the last 7 years and your education assisted you in getting or keeping your job, the community may well have benefitted and you may not owe anything back because the community received the benefit of the education.

You need to talk with an experienced family law attorney to assist you. You can consult with a lawyer about your question for little or no cost through a lawyer referral service in your area. You can find your nearest lawyer referral service by clicking on the link below.

Any useful answer will require a CAAREFUL analysis of ALL the facts with an EXPERIENCED family law attorney. Since the answer to this question will decide whether you are $79,000 up or down, definitely worth paying an expert to help.

The student loan is your separate obligation. To the extent It was paid off with community funds , your spouse can seek reimbursement to the community. There is some tracing and auditing involved. Also, a spouse in your situation sometimes claims "gift" .
